speaker: Best-Edited Half-Hour Series for Television
text: Ron Volk  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}          **A ROOM WITH FOUR VIEWS**    _Scene One - Frasier's Bathroom  The Bathroom is dark, lit only by candles.  Martin is having a massage.  He tells his story._

speaker: Martin
text: Ow!  Easy.

speaker: Masseur
text: Sorry, your neck is tight.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, it's been a tense couple of days.

speaker: Masseur
text: The holidays'll do that to you.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah well, this has been the worst Christmas ever.  It all  started yesterday...  _DISSOLVE TO: Frasier's Apartment.  Martin and Frasier are decorating  the tree by the balcony.  Niles is making a small decoration whilst  sipping his eggnog._

speaker: Martin
text: You know the only part about Christmas I don't like?  How  quickly it's all over!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Come December 26th, it's all just a memory.  With  nothing but your light decorating touch to remind us.    _Daphne enters the room with Eddie.  She watches the scene,  unknowingly under the mistletoe._

speaker: Daphne
text: Afternoon, all!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi Daphne!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  That's awfully dangerous, Daphne, standing there under  that mistletoe.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's enough eggnog, Niles! [_takes his cup away_]

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, the oddest thing just happened. [_Niles takes  Daphne's coat, sniffing the fragrances_] I was walking Eddie  past that church over on Chestnut.  And he turned to go  inside, like he assumed that was where we were going.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's strange!  He did exactly the same thing with me  yesterday when I was walking him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Any idea why he would do that, Mr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: Look, that dog's always doing weird things!  Yesterday, when  we were taking our bath together, Eddie spent fifteen straight  minutes pushing the soap around with his nose like an otter.  It's weird! [_goes into the kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, if he gets any weirder, we'll have to send "Eddie" to a  home.  _Frasier follows Martin into the kitchen.  Martin begins to pour  himself some eggnog.  Niles and Daphne stay in the living room._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm off, I've got all my Christmas shopping to do yet.

speaker: Martin
text: All of it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I'm determined not to settle this year.  I want my  gifts to be remembered and cherished long after the holidays.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, nothing is cherished quite so much as the gift  of laughter.

speaker: Frasier
text: If you want that "Highway Patrol Bloopers" tape, you're gonna  have to buy it yourself! [_Martin starts to take a sip_]  Oh, Dad!  You're not going to drink that that way, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Why?  _Frasier opens the cupboard and takes out some spices to enflavor  Martin's egg-nog._

speaker: Frasier
text: My Goodness, the first mistake in eggnog preparation is  failing to garnish it properly with a dash of nutmeg.  [_Frasier sprinkles some on_] There we are.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!    _Martin takes a sip and spits it out in a fit of coughing.  Frasier checks the jar._

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, the second mistake is placing the paprika next to  the nutmeg on the spice shelf.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_calls from the living room._] Mr. Crane, are you alright?

speaker: Frasier
text: We're fine, Daphne!  You all right, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm fine.  Listen Frasier, before you go, can I talk  to you for a minute?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well sure, what is it?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know what Daphne was talking about?  There is a  reason Eddie knows that church.  I've been taking him there.

speaker: Frasier
text: I guess the family that bathes together prays together.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, no.  But there's this priest, Father Curtis, he got to  know Eddie in the park and he asked if they could use him for  the Christmas pageant and I said sure.  Well, the next thing  I know, he's roped me in to play a shepherd.  Well then,  Dutch Gaansvort comes down with bronchitis and I get promoted  to a wise man...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, is there a point to this story looming somewhere on the  horizon?

speaker: Martin
text: As a wise man, I have to sing a song.  I said, well that was  fine, but this song's a killer.  I'm going to humiliate  myself!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, maybe you just need a little rehearsal.  Why don't  we work on it tonight?

speaker: Martin
text: Really?  Do you think that would help?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure!  You're a good singer, you're just a little rusty.  Start around eight?

speaker: Martin
text: OK.  Yeah, I am a good singer!  Remember those old family  picnics when I used to belt out "What's New, Pussycat"?

speaker: Frasier
text: We'll start around seven, then. [_walks out_]  Niles, hold the elevator!  _FADE OUT    Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment  Later, the Crane Boys are at the piano, when Martin enters holding  his song book._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey boys, this is that song I was telling you about, "Oh Holy  Night," do you know it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course Dad, it's a classic.  My God, it all builds  up to that one glorious note.  "Oh night, [_high_] de-viiiine,  oh..."

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, yes, that's the note I can't hit.  I practice in my room  and Eddie ends up burying his head under the pillow.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't worry, Dad, we'll get you there.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, can we just can this done?  I want to get it all  finished before Daphne gets back.  I don't want her to know  anything about this or she'll insist on coming down to the  pageant, and I'm nervous enough as it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sits at piano_] Let's just see what we have to work with.  Why don't you start here, "Oh night," and I want to hear you  really attack the note. [_plays_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_singing:_] Oh night,  When Christ was born.  Oh night di-viiiine!!    _Martin sings di-viiiine badly and Eddie ends up burying his head  under the pillow on the Armchair._

speaker: Niles
text: Sometimes the note sees the attack coming and retreats!

speaker: Martin
text: Shut up!  This bozo upstairs, he bangs on the floor every time  I start to sing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just ignore him, Dad.  I tell you what, there is another  vocal exercise I remember, it was very useful to me when  I was singing Colonel Fairfax in "Yeoman Of The Guard."  The principal is to distract yourself with a physical  exercise, thus freeing the voice.  You hit one note and  you slide up the octave as you descend slowly into a  crouched position.  Observe.

speaker: Frasier
text: You see?  It works.

speaker: Niles
text: That's very interesting.  I wonder if the reverse is true.  _So, he starts in a crouched position and slides down an octave as he  stands up.  The mad couple do this for a while, creating a strange  sight._

speaker: Frasier
text: Try it, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm afraid with three of us doing it, it might look  stupid.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm starting to think your problem is all psychological.  No, no, no, I think you've convinced yourself you can't reach  the note...

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I've convinced the guy upstairs too!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I think Niles may be right, Dad.  You just need some  positive reinforcement.  Let's try it again.  This time,  try to eliminate any negative thoughts.  Let's go again,  Niles, "Fall on your knees."  _Martin sings the carol, whilst Niles & Frasier (through fixed smiles)  throw in some positive encouragement.  _

speaker: Martin
text: "Fall on your knees..."

speaker: Frasier
text: I hear sweet music!

speaker: Martin
text: "Oh, hear the angels' voices..."

speaker: Niles
text: I hear one angel!

speaker: Martin
text: "Oh, night divine..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Something's divine!

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: "Oh night, when Christ was born..."

speaker: Frasier
text: A star is born!

speaker: Martin
text: "Oh, night..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Bring it home now!  _But even that doesn't work and Martin fails again, cracking apart on  "divine" - causing Eddie to bury his head under the pillow and the  man above to bang on the ceiling again._

speaker: All
text: Oh, shut up!  _FADE TO:    Scene Three - Bathroom  Now it's Daphne's turn for the Masseur.  She begins her story._

speaker: Masseur
text: Your shoulders are awfully tight.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, it's been a stressful few days.

speaker: Masseur
text: I'd be happy to listen.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no... well, it started yesterday.  I had something on my  mind.  Lucky for me, Dr. Crane's brother was over.  He's  always been such a good friend to me...    _DISSOLVE TO: replay of Scene One: the scene is set the same way as  before.  Martin and Frasier are decorating the tree by the balcony.  Niles is making a small decoration whilst sipping his eggnog.  Daphne enters the room with Eddie.  She watches the scene, unknowingly  under the mistletoe._

speaker: Daphne
text: Afternoon, all!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi Daphne!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's awfully dangerous, Daphne, standing under that  mistletoe.  A piece could fall into your eye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me freshen your drink, Niles! [_takes his cup away_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Dr. Crane.  The oddest thing just happened. [_Niles  takes Daphne's coat_] I was walking Eddie past that church over  on Chestnut, and he turned to go inside, like he assumed that  was where we were going.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's strange!  He did exactly the same thing yesterday when  I was walking him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Any idea why he would do that, Mr. Crane?

speaker: Martin
text: Nope! [_shrugs_] Dogs are weird!    _Frasier and Martin enter the kitchen. Niles and Daphne stay in the  living room and begin chatting._

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, that worries me a bit.

speaker: Niles
text: What does?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I think your father's been going to that church.  I had  an uncle who did the same thing.  He had no interest in church  his whole life.  Then he started going everyday.  It turns out  he had some bad health news from his doctor.  He didn't even  last a year.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, first of all, I can see you're upset, so come here.  [_they hug_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you, Dr. Crane, you're always so supportive!

speaker: Niles
text: And second of all, I think you're worrying over nothing.  I've never known my father to have so much as a hangnail  without letting everyone know about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's true.  Maybe I just got myself worked up remembering  my Uncle John.

speaker: Niles
text: Look at you, just saying his name gets you upset.  Come here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm fine!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, you need a hug.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, all right.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, are you alright?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] We're... fine, Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: See, nothing to worry about.  Well, I have got to run.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming out_] Oh, hold the elevator, Niles!  See you soon, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Bye!

speaker: Frasier
text: And, uh, Dad? [_hurries to the door_] Listen, don't worry.  We'll... Niles and I will... be there for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: What's that about?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, never mind!  Well, I gotta go lie down.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane,  did you ever call Dr. Stuart, for the results of  your physical?

speaker: Martin
text: Em, sure, couple of days ago.

speaker: Daphne
text: And?

speaker: Martin
text: Em, fine.  Come on, Eddie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is everything all right?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah.  It's just all over so fast!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_v.o._] Well, that was enough to convince me I was right.  And the next 24 hours were a living hell!  The worst came  the next day...  _DISSOLVE TO:    Scene Four - Apartment  Martin is on the phone to the church about the pageant as Daphne  enters with a shopping bag._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you know, I'm terrified about this, Father.  All this  came around so sudden.  I'm not prepared.  Now tell me again  what I'm supposed to say when I see Jesus the first time?  OK.  All right.  Well, thank you.  Yeah, see you soon, bye.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh hi, Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_brave smile_] Hello!  I'm just so excited about the gift I  just got for you, Mr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, great!

speaker: Daphne
text: Why don't you open it now?  [_puts a parcel on the Armchair_]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'd love to, but to tell you the truth, I don't really  have much time, I'm kind of on my way out. [_Daphne begins to  cry_] Oh, OK, all right!  I'll open it now, sure, sure.  I  don't want to get you upset!  You must be really excited about  this!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, wow!  It's that sweater!  The one I pointed out to you in  that window!  It's great!  Boy, I can die a happy man now!  [_Daphne bursts into tears_] Daphne, what's the matter, are you  all right?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Mr. Crane, I know why you've been going down to that  church!

speaker: Martin
text: You do?  Well, you're not supposed to know about that!  But why is it making you so upset?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because I care about you!  You were actually going to let this  whole thing happen without ever telling a soul!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yes!  I-I don't want people staring at me in church,  stiff as a board, all that makeup on my face.

speaker: Daphne
text: So... how much time have you got?

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, about twenty minutes.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_confused_] Twenty minutes?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, and boy, will I be glad when it's all over.  This is the  last Christmas pageant I'm ever signing up for!

speaker: Daphne
text: You're in a Christmas pageant?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yeah!  What did you think I was talking about?

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought you were dying!

speaker: Martin
text: What?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you'd just got your test results back, you're down at  the church all the time. [_Martin laughs_] Why are you laughing?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's funny!

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't think it's so bloody funny!

speaker: Martin
text: Are you kidding? [_acts as if hanged_] Oh, I'm dying!

speaker: Daphne
text: You will be! [_hurls a pillow at him_]

speaker: Martin
text: What are you doing?  Daphne, don't do that!  _They argue for a while before starting to throw pillows at each other.  Meanwhile, Niles enters - his suit is a rag, his face is smeared and  he can hardly walk.  He collapses behind the sofa, which stops Martin's  and Daphne's argument.    FADE TO:    Scene Five - Bathroom  Daphne finishes her story, and Niles is now being massaged by the  Masseur._

speaker: Masseur
text: You can talk about it if you like.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm not ready just yet. [_falls asleep_]    _End of Act One.  Time: (10:55)    Act Two.    Scene Six - Bathroom  Niles is lying on his back on the massage table._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I can't tell you how good that feels.  I don't think I've  ever had a massage like this before!  _The camera pans up the table to show that Daphne is the Masseuse this  time, dressed in a short, white nurse's uniform and massaging his calf._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm glad.  As long as you're so relaxed, maybe I should  just give you your Christmas present right now.  _Daphne climbs onto the table, lies on top of him and they kiss deeply.  Suddenly, Niles is woken up by the real Masseur._

speaker: Niles
text: OW!  You woke me up!

speaker: Masseur
text: Sorry, I guess this ankle's a bit tender.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, yours would be too if you'd had the day I had...  _DISSOLVE TO: the Elliot Bay Towers lobby: Niles is waiting for the  elevator._

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] I'd gone out to do some shopping, then I arrived at  Frasier's building.  _The elevator doors open, he enters it.  There is an elderly husband  and wife there (Albert & Jane) and a woman about his age (Doris).  He squeezes in next to an inappropriate, extremely large Christmas  tree that takes up most of the car._

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me.  I'm sorry, I don't mean to crowd you.  This is a  brand-new, hand-tailored Italian suit.  You know how difficult  it is to get sap out of silk.

speaker: Albert
text: Another reason we didn't need this tree.

speaker: Jane
text: Oh, Albert!

speaker: Albert
text: This thing's a fire hazard.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, they make a chemical now that you can use to  fireproof a tree.

speaker: Albert
text: It causes cancer.

speaker: Niles
text: Happy Holidays, then.

speaker: Jane
text: What just happened?

speaker: Doris
text: I think the elevator's stopped.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, not to worry, I'm sure we'll get it going in a moment.

speaker: Albert
text: We've probably got about twenty minutes of oxygen.

speaker: Niles
text: Sir, you're just going to alarm everyone.

speaker: Doris
text: I work in an ER.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah!  Well, perhaps you can instruct these people on the best  way to stay cool in a crisis.

speaker: Doris
text: I was on duty that night the elevator cable snapped at the  Bing building.  And they brought those people in on cookie  sheets.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, is anyone there?

speaker: Repairman
text: Yeah, who is it?

speaker: Niles
text: There's a group of us stuck in one of your elevators.  The doors won't open and we can't seem to move off the  8th floor.

speaker: Repairman
text: All right, where are you calling from, sir?

speaker: Niles
text: The Elliot Bay Towers.

speaker: Repairman
text: Well, both my crews are out, it could be a good hour-and-  a-half before I could get anybody there.

speaker: Doris
text: But I can't wait that long, my children are alone upstairs  in the apartment!

speaker: Albert
text: You haven't got a gas oven up there, have you?

speaker: Repairman
text: Well, there is another way.  If somebody felt like climbing  through the trap door on top of your car, there's a manual  release switch up there that would open up your doors.

speaker: Doris
text: Well, that's what we've gotta do then, somebody's gotta go  up there.

speaker: Albert
text: Uhhh, that's a pretty small opening.

speaker: Niles
text: Well obviously, I have more confidence in your wife than  you do. [_cups his hands toward Jane_] Step this way, ma'am,  I'll give you a leg up. [_Albert slaps his hands down_]

speaker: Doris
text: It has to be you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, uh, I'd have - how do you expect me to get up there?

speaker: Doris
text: Well, you can climb up the tree.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come on.

speaker: Doris
text: Well now, surely you climbed plenty of trees when you were  a boy.

speaker: Jane
text: That's Dr. Crane's brother.

speaker: Albert/Doris
text: Oh...

speaker: Niles
text: [_purses his lips_] Fine.  I suppose in times of crisis,  someone must step forward and be a hero.

speaker: Niles
text: Today that man is Niles Crane!  Tomorrow, it will be my dry  cleaner, Mr. Lee.

speaker: Albert
text: All right, come on now, grab his feet and we'll push him  through. [_everyone does_]

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, wait, not so fast!

speaker: Niles
text: [_o.s._] No, not to worry, I landed in a nice, soft puddle of  grease.  I just have to find the release switch, bear with  me...

speaker: Doris
text: Quick!

speaker: Niles
text: Did that do anything?  People?  Lady with my coat?  [_sticks his head back down_]  Where'd you all go?    _He gapes as the elevator doors slide shut again, blocking him from  the camera's view._

speaker: Niles
text: [_from inside the shaft_] Oh my God!  We're going up!  Someone  stop this thing!  _DISSOLVE TO: the 19th Floor.  The elevator doors open, and Niles and  the tree tumble into the hallway.  He crawls out, his suit in tatters  and covered in mud and grease._

speaker: Niles
text: [_every inch agony_] Ow...

speaker: Woman In Hall
text: Why is that man crawling?

speaker: Man In Hall
text: That's Dr. Crane's brother.

speaker: Woman In Hall
text: Oh...    _He stands up and rights himself, then enters the apartment.  He walks in on Martin and Daphne arguing, as before, but  with considerably more grace than in Daphne's recollection._

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] I was slightly shaken by what I had done, but I'd  completely composed myself as I arrived at Frasier's.  But  it was some time later that I was able to tell them what had  happened...    _DISSOLVE TO: that night: Niles is sitting on the sofa with Daphne,  while Frasier watches._

speaker: Niles
text: Of course, I have no idea what you use to get elevator grease  out of silk!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, brown suede seems to leaching it out nicely! [_doorbell  sounds_] Anyway, no Christmas is complete without a bit of  tumult.  But now we can all relax and enjoy a lovely holiday  evening together.

speaker: Roz
text: Merry Christmas!  _She throws a gift box onto the floor - inside, there is the sound of  glass breaking - and turns back to the elevator.  Frasier follows her  out.    CUT TO:    Scene Seven - Bathroom  Roz is now on the massage table.  She tells her story._

speaker: Roz
text: You sure you wanna hear about this?

speaker: Masseur
text: Why not?

speaker: Roz
text: OK.  Well, I've been feeling a little depressed lately,  because I've been putting on all this weight, I'm pregnant...  _DISSOLVE TO:  Her story begins in Caf e Nervosa, where Niles, Frasier and Martin  are having their usual rendezvous.  Roz enters and sits down._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys! [_they all greet her; to Niles_] That's a nice suit.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thank you.  It's brand new, and so since you'll probably  be ordering food, I think I'll just go, rather than risk  getting it stained.

speaker: Roz
text: What is that supposed to be?  Some kind of crack about how  much I eat?

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely not, it was a crack about your table manners.  [_leaves_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I should go too.  I just got a couple of hours before  the pageant and I need the time to rehearse.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not to worry, Dad.  Come tomorrow, it'll all be a memory.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but even after it's all over, I still have to make  peace with the man upstairs!    _Daphne runs into the bathroom, crying.  When Martin leaves,  Roz starts her chat._

speaker: Roz
text: So, Frasier, are you sure we have to do this charity thing  this afternoon?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Roz.  It's just an hour out of your life!  Besides, I think you're gonna make an adorable Mrs. Claus.

speaker: Roz
text: Why?  Because now I look so much like her, because I've  gotten so fat?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Why, yes, Mrs. Doyle, yes, she is.  Just a moment.  [_to Roz_] It's your mom, they forwarded her from the office.

speaker: Roz
text: [_into phone:_] Hello, Mom?  Yes, I got your message.  Yep,  I'm picking you up at the airport, 10 AM.  Right, I'm looking  forward to seeing you, too.  Bye!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, wait, wait, let me say "Merry Christmas!"

speaker: Roz
text: Hang on, Mom!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Mrs. Doyle!  Yes, Frasier again.  Hi, happy  holidays! [_lowers voice_] Uh, listen, just a word to the wise:  Roz has put on quite a few pregnancy pounds of late, and she's  really sensitive about it.  So, you know, I would just say be  careful what you say to her, alright? [_Roz comes back_] Bye-  bye, yes, we'll see you soon, bye!

speaker: Roz
text: [_picks up her things_] You know, Frasier, I think I'll meet you  over there.  I still have a couple of gifts to get!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God!  I still have all of mine to get.  You know, no  matter how hard I try, I just can't seem to find anything  that seems quite right this year!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, it's really sweet how you're trying to make all your gifts  special.  I'm sorry I've been so cranky, I'm just nervous  about my mom coming.  I'm sort of just dreading the big  conversation where I finally tell her I'm pregnant.  _About thirty seconds must pass before Frasier can speak, during which  he inanely pats her shoulder and smiles comfortingly._

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean you haven't told her yet?

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's just not the type of thing you blurt out over the  phone!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'll let you get that.  I'll see you over there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right. [_Roz leaves; he answers his phone_] Hello?  Yes, I had  a feeling you might call back!  _DISSOLVE TO: Scene Eight - Shopping Mall  Later, Frasier and Roz are Mr. & Mrs. Claus.  Frasier is already  dressed in full attire on his chair.  Roz enters dressed as Mrs.  Claus._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz!  There you are, I was beginning to worry about you.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you should have!  I am on the verge of a complete  breakdown!  Shopping was a disaster!  And when I went to  slip into this darling little costume, my pants split.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!

speaker: Roz
text: And on top of all that, I can't stop thinking about my mom!  How am I going to tell her?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz, if you'd like, I could tell her for you.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you kidding?!  She's gonna be mad enough that _I_ waited  three months to tell her, the only thing worse would be to  hear it from someone else!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's entirely possible she already knows.

speaker: Roz
text: No way, the only person who knows she's spoken to is you-

speaker: Frasier
text: [_welcoming first girl_] OK!  Ho-ho-ho, who's first?

speaker: Roz
text: What is wrong with you?  I'm going to kill you!

speaker: Sally
text: You're going to kill Santa?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, little girl, Mrs. Claus just wants to _kiss_ me.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I'll kiss you.  Come 'ere, I'll kiss you good!  [_gives Sally a candy cane_] Here, run along! [_to Frasier_]  Are you insane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you tell your mother everything, how was I supposed to  know?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ho-ho-ho.

speaker: Billy
text: Hi Santa, I want a pony for Christmas.

speaker: Roz
text: You got it, now beat it!

speaker: Billy
text: [_running off_] Mommy, Mommy, I'm gonna get a pony!

speaker: Frasier
text: Can't we talk about this later?

speaker: Roz
text: No, we can't!

speaker: Vic
text: Hi, Santa.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh My God!  What are you, twenty?  Get outta here! [_Vic  leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, will you just try to stay calm?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I will not stay calm!  Because I am not calm, I am  completely _freaked!_ [_slams her glasses to the ground_]  I am pregnant, and you told my crazy mother, and my  Christmas is ruined, and I'm too fat to even be Mrs.  Santa, and I hate this holiday!    _She runs out, kicking a bag of presents.  The mothers and children  look shocked._

speaker: Frasier
text: Mrs. Claus was up very late last night.  _DISSOLVE TO: Scene Nine - Frasier's Apartment  Roz is outside Frasier's door with a gift box, angrily stabbing the  doorbell._

speaker: Roz
text: [_v.o._] Of course I still had to stop by Frasier's, I had to  give him his champagne glasses.  _Frasier answers the door, and Roz once again throws the present to  the floor shouting "Merry Christmas!"  Frasier once again goes after  her._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, don't go!  Come on, look, I'm sorry about what happened,  but it was a mistake, you can't stay mad at me.

speaker: Roz
text: I still have to face my mother tomorrow!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we can talk about that.  Come on in.  Please, come in?  [_caressing her belly_] Look, how would it look if I turned  a pregnant lady away on Christmas Eve when there's so much  room here at the inn?    _Roz rolls her eyes, but allows Frasier to steer her back inside.  Daphne and Niles are sitting there moodily, Daphne with her head  resting on her arm, Niles still picking elevator grease from his  suit.  Frasier tries to cheer things up._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Daphne, Roz is here!

speaker: Niles/Daphne
text: [_bored_] Hi.

speaker: Roz
text: [_imitating_] Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, people!  Let's liven things up a little, it's  Christmas Eve!  What are the Cranes known for if not their  legendary holiday spirit?

speaker: Martin
text: I hate singing and I hate Christmas and I'm going to bed!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what happened?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I went into my song and everything was going fine.  Then we come up to the high note, and I actually think I'm  going to hit it for once.  Then I look over and I see Eddie.  He's got his head buried in the Christ Child's cradle!  Well,  I guess he mistook the Christ Child for one of his chew toys  because he grabs a hold of it inis teeth and starts shaking  it!  So, the Virgin Mary grabbed hold of its legs, well, you  know how Eddie likes a good tug-of-war, so they're going at  it, then Eddie runs out of there with it still in his mouth  and half the population of Bethlehem chasing after him!  I never should have agreed to be in that pageant!

speaker: Daphne
text: You would have saved me a lot of grief!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't start this again!

speaker: Niles
text: Don't you talk to her like that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now come on everybody, let's not say something we're going  to regret!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you're one to talk!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shouting_] ALL RIGHT! THAT IS ENOUGH! [_they shut up_] This is  the night we celebrate _peace_ and _togetherness_!  I will not  have that ruined! [_slowly_] I intend to put us all in the right  frame of mind, by giving you all my gift.  As you know, I was  determined to make my gifts this year a little more  meaningful.  And after a great deal of effort I believe I  have.  My gift does not come from some fancy store, all  wrapped in glittery paper, my gift comes from my heart.  Tonight, I intend to sit each one of you down, and tell  you in my own words, exactly how much you mean to me.  _The rest then begin commenting on how awful the present is: "That's  it?"  "Are you out of your mind?" "That's the worst idea I ever heard!"_

speaker: Frasier
text: Or, I could get someone over to give us all massages.  _The rest say what a much better idea that is after four tough days.  Frasier picks up the phone.    End of Act Two.  Time: (21:22)_
